content: Pretty good but not all the vocab, would have been better if they had the "additional vocabulary" from the book in here as well but this is exactly what it said it is, flash cards
Very good, really helps me study vocabulary
I love the repetition. Helps me remember the more I see and hear the words.

I cannot use the app at all. When I opened up the app, there is a notice with some words stating that the app isn't a Google download and the service ran out. In other words, the app is useless. Unbelievable!

App does not implement SRS or spaced repetition system that is proven to assist in transferring short term memory to long term due to an increasing and decreasing space of time between vocabulary words. Once that is changed to use SRS it would be an actually useful app specifically for the price of $6

Deserves more that its current score! I find it to be a very useful resource and I've learned a lot by using it. The cards are organised by lesson and you can test yourself from English to Japanese or vice versa. There are nice pictures on the cards, example sentences and audio. It's not perfect, but it's still definitely worth the cash.
Love this app ❤

Very, very basic functionality. This app is only good if you're too lazy to write the vocab on flash cards yourself. Not that it's bad, it does what it says, but I think it could do a lot better for something that charges people for access.
Who made this? Have they never heard about contrast? The text is ridiculously hard to read!
this is a bad app it doesnt even let you study really your better off just getting anki
Definitely useful when paired with the book. Both this app and the conjugation app. The Kanji one is not very useful as you will want to actually be drawing them on paper repeatedly.

Let me begin by saying I use this app OFTEN. It is far better than carrying around a ton of flash cards. HOWEVER, two things I wish would change; First being tapping the words to show the answer. I would prefer it stay on the screen longer than 2 milliseconds. Second, I would like to see an option while practicing to hear the word spoken. I know you can go to a different location to do this but it would be far better to just be able to so it while your studying the words.

Not a great application for review, they aren't actual flash cards, just the word written on it and asks if you remember it or not. Would prefer an application that would provide multiple choice, or have you write the answer if you got it right. Not worth the money when free applications have a better structure to learning and practice.
It isn't designed well for mobile ironically, with many things overlapping. A shame really.
dictionary is not alphabetical order. Its really hard to find the words in the list form :/
Doesnt contain all of the words in chapter 1, agree that it's not conducive to learning as there is no mixing option. Buyer beware no refunds on this app.
Waste of money
The app and content are excellent, but I wish that it had spaced-repetition. The fact that it doesn't means that I will just keep using Anki instead.
Worthless app. Just a list of vocab words without English definitions. There isn't even a clear mapping to the textbook. I recommend using any other flash card app.

Easy 5 stars.... I was initially put off by the humble simple not so standardized look of the app.  Especially compared to other flash card apps. App is meant to integrate with the text book, however it is valuable on its own. What you get: Normally used Kanji has hiragana superscripts. Audio examples of word on front of card and audio examples of simple sentences on the back of card.  The audio is spoken at a reasonable speed. Good simple kanji/hiragana/katakana sentence examples on the back of the card, where the rest of the sentence is at the learning level of the card. You can review the cards as Japanese or English. You can shuffle cards You can temporarily remove cards that you already know. You can pick multiple lesson card sets. An English<>Japanese dictionary where all of the entries are from the cards. Cards are grouped by the learning level of the text book.  What could be better: If your screen is set to full zoom, the show answer button covers the hiragana. Dictionary when viewed as English is alphabetized only by the first letter of the word, so you have to look for the word.

Pros: Get all vocabulary in one place with audio and flash cards Cons: The UI is a little bulky and dated At 6 dollars, is quite expensive for a simple flashcard app  Ultimately, I would still buy it simply because of the convenience. However, it truly is overpriced.
Awesome app to work with the book. Worth to buy. First steps a little bit confusing (interface isn't intuitive), better to see tutorials first. But totally recommended.
The apps don't work on my phone and I'm having difficulty getting a refund. I'm very upset with Google Play and the app developer.
Serviceable. Does NOT have all the vocab from the newest edition of Genki despite being advertised on the damn book. Disappointed.

Unfortunately it is just a word list, with yes/no/unsure buttons to let the user self assess their own ability. It has not helped me at all, I would like a refund. I was hoping for a quiz feature that would help me learn.
THE best app for learning Japanese Vocabulary!

I'm glad I ignored the bad reviews. This companion app is fantastic if you have the books. A few reviews just don't know how to use the app. You can shuffle, you can get the English translation. Yes it is a bit overpriced, but honestly genki is the best way to learn Japanese and worth the money. This app makes that process a dream. It's clear, simple and lines up with the books perfectly. It has English first or Japanese first, a practice and a test mode and a restore so you can test and learn.
Great to help me study my vocab words when ever I have a minute to spare
don't pay $10 for digital flash cards

Read some of the negative reviews... I think the app has been updated. I find it easy to use and worth it. Can quiz in either direction...just shows the English, or just shows the Japanese. Also includes sentence for context. Plus, it reads it alowed if you wish. Excellent aid to learning vocabulary, which I have a hard time with.

Great for short daily vocab practice (which has been proven to be the best way to learn). The other reviewers seem to take this for granted. There is a shuffle mode if you actually take the time to look at the settings. This is much more convenient than real flashcards or using Quizlet which has too many errors. I trust the book and app since my Japanese teacher reccommended it. She helps me put together sentences with correct grammar structure. Arigatou gozaimasu Genki Vocab Cards!

It's a bit sad that it's "just flashcards" based on the book with no real benefit over physical flashcards except for always being able to access them on the phone. Furthermore, the app is not exactly pretty and not designed well. Maybe the developers should look at other learning apps like Memrise, Duolingo or Drops, just to give them an idea of the possibilities a smartphome provides to assist you with learning vocabulary.
Thisca complex and quite rigidly designed app aimed at students using the Genki textbook. I am using the book but as pensioner tourist the vocab offered is often irelevant.

Its literally just a premade list of words broken out by lesson. Theres not even an option to shuffle your "deck" of selected words. There are two modes, review the list in the preset order, or take a quiz where you answer correctly once and the word is removed from your list unless you go in the options and manually readd it to the list. it needs serious improvement to be worthwhile.
Very helpful

I was excited to have this app as additional practice to go along with the workbook, but unfortunately, for the price, this app is absolutely garbage. It is very poorly designed and looks as if it were designed in fifteen minutes. I would have happily paid $0 for this app though.
Totally not worth it, even it were free.
Very helpful flash card studying on the go. A fair price. I could see myself spending the same amount of money on a deck of flashcards to write them myself
You have to have internet to use it.
Overglorified for the price. The IOS version is superior in every way which isn't fair because we're paying the same price. Please make this app cool like the ios version so we get what we paid for.
I love it! Great to remember words since I'm studying Japanese it really comes in handy.

WAY OVERPRICED!!! The same vocab flashcard sets are a Quizlet search away. 
Maybe worth it if it cost $1 or $2 (at most). Plus waaay more people would 
buy at that price since it is so covienent. Also, if we bought the books 
why is there no discount code!?!?!?!

Good companion app however.. if there is an audio option somewhere to hear 
the word you are practicing in english and japanese, i cant find it. It 
seems like a missed opportunity for pronunciation practice. If there is 
audio in here somewhere then please let me know where.
Waste of money. Quality is not high. Format is not user friendly. Don't buy.

This is a very useful app that helps with learning the vocab along with the 
Genki workbook. I did notice the bug with the words not appearing after 
touching. It appeared randomly after a while of using it and figured out 
that it was because my phone was put on battery saver mode. I took it off 
battery saver and it worked normally again.

When will the conjugation app come out for android also these app wont do 
you any good if you don't have the books for the people giving this app a 
low rating

Way too expensive for what the app is. Glorified flashcards. With that 
being said, the app is organized well and is useful because of its exact 
correlation with the books. It also shows example sentences that not only 
showcase the vocab but uses the grammar from the chapter. BUT, it has a few 
translations that are wrong. Specifically a sentence on 15-4 "to reserve" 
should be past tense.

I just pay almost $6 for an app that has bad translation (はじめまして:how do you 
do?) and the card does not show the answer when you finish. Terrible! Do 
not waste your money! I can't believe this people make such bad app for 
they good book...
I love this and the kanji app, but when is the grammar app coming to Android?
Perfect to reinforce what I've learnt in the books! ^_^
IT KEEPS CRASHNG UPON OPENING IT
I just paid 7€ for this app and the vocabulary trainer won't even show me the translation, regardless which option I choose! Please fix this issue ASAP!!!
Once the vocab card bug is fixed I will resubmit as 5 stars. When reviewing, it will not show the answer when you tap the card. It used to but it suddenly stopped working.
There is no option to remove the Hiragana from the cards (at the bottom of the Kanji).
This should be given for free when you purchase the book. It does not deserve this extra payment. You can buy much more complex apps that work independently from the book for the same money.

Good app to go along with the book. The only thing that made me give a 3 star is the fact the speaker icon costs the hiragana translation when kanji is used. Makes it nearly impossible for a new learner like me to know what it is...
Spaced repetition is absolutely vital for a flashcard app.

Amazing app! Great for learning the book vocab. Love the fact it has book two vocab already so I can get a head start before I buy the book. I have only one problem so far, and that is that the sound symbol will sometimes hide the furigana for kanji when in MyDeck. A quick fix for this is to flip the card over, however you then get the answer. Update:  After using this app for a little while I have discovered the kinks in the system. One being the ui working in a weird way including what seems to be a reverse highlight on what settings you have active. I am reasy ro actually go back to making anki cards using just the word and answer. Seems great at first but needs a lot of rethinking.

this app is a great compliment to the genki books and is very useful for drilling the vocabulary words. only wish they had a way to turn off the furigana once the pronunciation is learned, maybe on the next update. definitely worth buying.

The app is good for cutting some time from writing flash cards to memorize vocab for the class I take using the Genki books. The lack of flexibility to orginze my deck is frustrating however. Every time I would like to refresh the deck of unknown vocab I have to sift through all the words I know by heart or have no need to learn at the moment. They have split the chapters into sections however the don't always split logically, say having the first section covering half of the nouns, then the second covering the second half of the nouns that just the い-adjectives. Over all positive but only if you're willing to deal with sifting your deck each time you start studying fresh
Good for practicing.
Waste of money. Get a free flashcard app.

First of all, i get why some people dont like this app.  It is definitely a companion app to the textbook/workbooks, and it is intended to accompany a class based on those books.    Now, if you are taking a class that yses the genki books, great.  Get this app.  It will help you study for exams without having to waste time making flashcards.  Otherwise, maybe consider saving money to get a different app.  There are flashcard apps that are free.   Also, if you want to learn kanji, check out wanikani, it is awesome.  You get way more for free.  (But pay for high level studies)  Basically, this app is for people with the books and taking a class.  Otherwise, it is very incomplete and a waste of money.  This app should really be free.

Content is great. App is poorly designed. Does not contain 'additional vocab' sections. Add the missing vocab and replace the terrible 'Yes/No/Unsure' review system with something more helpful and this could be a 5* app

It's annoying that the most important feature doesn't work. In check mode, when you tap on the word, the meaning in the other language is supposed to be displayed so you can double-check if you really know the word. But this doesn't work.

I have no complaint about the content at all. My only suggestion would be to make the text larger. The Kana and kanji used are a bit small and some of us have eyes that are not as young as they once were. Perhaps make the size of the Japanese text scalable?
No need to make your own quizlets now.

Wow,  what are the people who give 4 stars for this smoking?  It's a simple vocabulary and not a good ui or good looking either.  Looks like somebody cobbled this up while learning Android development in college... I can't believe I paid almost $6 for this...

I've used all of the Genki apps for iPhone and they were really helpful so I'm glad they're finally being released for Android. I've been using this on the subway on my way to and from school and it has helped enormously. I'd definitely recommend this over any free third-party flash card apps if you can afford it, just for the quality and consistency of an app that was made for your textbook. I just got the kanji app as well, and I hope the conjugation one will come soon.

When testing the vocabulary,  it would be better if there was an option to hide the hiragana/katakana so that we could get used to looking at words that have kanji. And please add the other apps on android!
Need the Kanji version now, and my learning apps will be complete.
Please add filters to study just ru-verbs or u-verbs or adjectives, etc. Other than that great addition to the book.

Fairly useful for learning the vocabulary through repetition. It's pretty inexcusable that there isn't a section for testing Kanji though. They could also do a better job of letting you test yourself by adding some utilities like shuffling your deck, etc.

This app doesn't help at all. There's no learning involved, it just asks if you know it or not, but it doesn't help you at all. There's no check your answer option so if you "think you know it" and you're completely wrong, it'll never tell you. Nor will it let you see what ones you know or don't know. Huge disappointment.
No test, quiz functionality. No Romaji. Really terrible layout instructions.  This app needs a serioua redesign to ask $5.99.  Got my refund but I'm disappointed as I wanted it to be useful
It doesn't even have all the vocab in the book like numbers, family members, hours, minutes etc.

As someone who knows Chinese, the kanji is very bad in Japanese mode because I peek at the kanji and immediately know what the word means, which defeats the purpose of hiding the English text. I'm covering the kanji with my finger for now, but I'd love a way to hide the kanji. Other than that, love the app.
Helps with recognition but would be better with audio and or romanji answers to aid in pronunciation.

Very clean app.  However there is an issue that I feel is a bit of an oversight. I would like the ability to have the kana and the image show without the English when in Japanese mode. The same as the English mode but in reverse (Kana + image).  Will 5 star if this is addressed.

This app replaces a lot of flash cards! I find it simple to use and effective. The app has all of the features that a physical stack of flash cards gives you, including the card shuffling, and then it add the pronunciation, examples and pictures. All in all, I find it definitely to be worth the money and money. I look forward to getting the Genki II vocabulary in here as well.
Definitely needs the ability to play the audio in "check" mode -- otherwise great!
Need to be able to play the audio and see the card for the word while in testing (check) mode. Need more options for testing - typing, listening etc.
I love that this is for android now too, but when can we expect the genki conjugation and genki Kanji apps for android as well? Those are the ones that would be so, so useful to me.
replyContent: We have plans to make the Kanji and Conjugation apps, too, sometime within this year or next. Please wait for the releases. Thank you.

content: I love genki books! I don't need to create my own tango clips to review. I can now rely on this app. The app is good but still need some improvements. I hope you can also add the kanjis. Also, the UI is a little bit weird for first time users so I hope you can improve the UI designs. So far so good!. Thank you! :)
I'm very happy that this came to Android. I'm already finding it a useful companion to the textbook.

I really like the app but the way you memorise the words just doesn't click with me. It gives you the word and you click if you know it yet or not or if you are unsure (don't know how that differs from know). Then you can be tested on the words you don't know and it asks you if you know them again. This probably really works for some people though. All in all it is a usefull app as it has all the words in genki in one place; however, for the price I feel like  there should be more ways to learn.
This is one of the best apps for following along with the book. I only wish I had this last year.
I have been waiting for this to come to Android for so long! Thank you for making this app for those of us that don't have iPhones! UPDATE: Yay!! You fixed the check thingy! :-D

It's nice that the app has all the vocab as flash cards, that can be very helpful, but it doesn't have specific sections for the kanji in the books. It also could be a bit more extensive on the ways you can quiz yourself. For the price, and the fact that most people are also paying for the books, I believe it should include quite a but more.
I have been waiting for for this and so glad that I have it now!!
Where have you been in all my life?! I'm taking japanese classes at my college using the Genki txt book. This app will bring the convenience to study on the go. Thank you for making this!
It would benefit from a shuffle function of the "flashcards".
Gives the actual pronunciation along with the flash card. Very useful app to use along with the text book. I'll be using it a lot for sure!
